Using Approved Insulation Ductwrap materials - Multitel 18kg Density foiled 1-side 25mm thick
Cover entire surface with insulation including all flanges, stiffeners and support angles.
Provide 50mm over lapping at all joints.
Tape all joints with 75mm width (72mm on the Market) Aluminium foiled tape.
Fixing for all Duct size 375mm to 750mm steel weld pins on centreline at 400mm spacing bottom surface only.
Fixing for all Duct size 750mm and greater steel weld pins at 400mm spacing maximum.
Fixing for all Duct riser steel weld pins at 400mm spacing maximum.
Using additional polypropylene fixing Bands 600mm centres.
Provide an overlap of atleast 300mm where insulation changes from the inside of the duct to the outside.

Using Approved Insulation Fire rated Ductwrap materials - 38mm thick Fyrewrap Elite 1.5 (FRL 120/120/120)
Fyrewrap duct wrap must completely covered the duct and there must not be any exposed sections or gaps.
A 100mm minimum overlap must be used on all joints. Only the Three specified methods (telescope, checkerboard and butt splice methods.) of overlap may be used when adjoining Fyrewrap duct wraps.
Cut edges must be completely sealed with the specified pressure-sensitive aluminium foiled tape.
≤600 x600 duct size Steel banding only spacing 40mm from edges over the overlap and one additional between overlaps.
≤1200 x1200 duct size Steel banding and pins bottoms only spacing 40mm from edges over the overlap and one additional between overlaps. Pre-welded Pins grid 200mm centres.
≥1200 x1200 duct size pins only all sides of duct pre-welded Pins grid 200mm centres.
Wall penetrations up to 1600mm duct size 75mm x 75mm x1.6mm steel angle 100mm width x 60mm thick maxilite board.
Length of second layer from the fire barrier FRL 60/60/60
Duct size 600mm x 600mm or less -second layer 1350mm
Duct size 600mm x 1200mm or less -second layer 1600mm
Used only Trafalgar Access Panels -must be fitting directly over the existing duct access panels fixed with rivets and fyreflex fire rated sealant, with a second local layer of Fyrewrap.

Tube is cut by suitable means, ends are deburred & cleaned of any filings, and surfaces prepared with light grade emery paper.
Joint fit has correct clearance and expanded end of tube (if applicable) is to correct length for pipe size - as per NDY specified requirements
Heat from Oxy Acetylene torch is being applied uniformly to the fitting, and torch flame is slightly reducing/carburising.
Silfos used is 15% and is being applied so that through capillary action is achieved around the entire joint.
Shoulder build-up of Sipfos is just present around the entire circumference of the brazed joint, and completed joint is left to air cool.

Using Approved Insulation Duct materials - Fibreglass
Fixed with Adhesive weld pins and speed clips located not more than 75mm from the edges of the ducts and spaced not more than 300mm centres.
Joints taped between adjacent of insulation with a 75mm wide strip of reinforced aluminium foil laminate tape.
Tape joints protected with 75mm wide sheet metal cover strip, pop riveted to the corner angles.
Approved materials have been used - 0.6mm galvanised sheet metal, or 0.8mm stucco embossed aluminium
Min. 40mm overlap has been provided on longitudinal and circumferential joints
Coned down ends of sheathing have been provided where insulation has been specified as being coned down
All bends have been neatly cut and formed into lobster-back segments
In applications not involving a vapour barrier, pop rivets are provided through pre-drilled holes
In applications involving vapour barrier, 12mm wide straps of 0.4mm sheet metal are used to secure cladding
Straps on straight lengths are no fewer than 3 on each section, c/w locking buckles
Suitcase Clips' are used for all readily removable items such as evaporator heads, strainers, etc which require access for routine maintenance
Penetrations are sealed for gauges, instruments, and drain vents (silicone)
Approved materials have been used (e.g. Elastomeric closed cell insulation), min 9m thick
Entire surface of pipe is covered from the indoor units' condensate trap, for a distance of 2m down the line
Adhesive is applied to any longitudinal and circumferential joints, as well as to the ends of the insulation to the pipe
Finish circumferential joints by wrapping with 50mm wide pressure-sensitive pre-adhered PVC tape.
